storyInfo: Twenty-six years ago, the Duke of Cumberland's manor was host to a dinner party, with the King and the nobles gathered all in one place. It was there that news arrived of Victorian Realmblade, Kyngasycath, the Sighs of Kings, going missing.

attributes.content: Twenty-six Years Ago...
5:11 P.M. \ Overcast
Residence of the Duke of Cumberland, Auchterigg District of Londinium
Your Majesty... I've just received word. Those two pitiful Members have died in their cells.
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: An end they deserve. It's time Parliament understood they serve Victoria, and not the businessmen stuffing their pockets with coin.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: I understand your eagerness. Still, some are worried. Your pressure on the Court has terrified a great deal of Members who had been observing the situation. They may act with impropriety in days to come.
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: They should be fearful! They'll better know their places.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: This unbroken succession of wars whiles away the riches our forebears accumulated over the ages, yet certain greedy condorwings have been reared—fattened by them.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: I'm not looking for you to back down, but if we could just go a little slower...
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: A little slower! As if the condorwings know when to stop. Why don't you look for them to feed a little slower?
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: If we don't put our new tax policies in place, then once the enemy sees fit to pounce on Victoria and tear her flesh apart, even the mercenaries will leave us without a second thought!
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: If they consider themselves soldiers clear of mind and honorable of heart, they will stand by your side.
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: I'm afraid the Red Dragon thought as much too, before he was forced to share half his crown.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: We all saw the end that befell him.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: I promise you, no matter the hour, you will have Cumberland's loyalty.
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: Of course, 'Cumberland the Ever on High'—how could I doubt where you stand?
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: But you see, Robert, Victoria is in her hour of need, this very moment. The right of kings is waning upon this swathe of soil.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: Why does Your Majesty think so?
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: It's your birthday the day after. Everyone is hoping to catch a glimpse of your visage. The servicemen are impatient to pay their respects to you, and the populace's cheers are sure to drown out the parade in turn.
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: This year, perhaps. But what of next year? And when it comes time for my Alexandrina to succeed the throne?
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: Robert, we will make our exit, sooner or later.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: Your Majesty! You—
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: Your Majesty, Your Grace.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Pardon me for bothering you without permission, but I've just had a report—
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: There has been an intrusion in the Palace underground. The Sighs of Kings is unaccounted for.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: ...What?
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: And... so is Her Highness Alexandrina.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: The Guard have sealed off all areas of connection, and the search is underway, but no leads have surfaced for the time being.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Her Highness Alexandrina and the Victorian Realmblade have gone missing at once, in this sensitive a situation?
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: No. No noble would be this brazen. But...
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: Your Majesty, I assure you, I will personally handle this affair, straight away. I'll...
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: Don't be flustered, my old friend. Alexandrina's long-time mentor accompanies her. I trust no one will pose a threat to her safety.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: Her mentor? As in...?
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: He treats Alexandrina very well. I can't recall if he's ever even shown me the same level of concern.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: As for our Sighs of Kings, no matter where it is, it will play its role.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: You mean... the role of a Realmblade?
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: Hah. It'll be grasped by a righteous ruler before those academics conduct their endless research on it. That is what a Realmblade stands for.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: And we all look forward to the coming of that day.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: I understand.
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: Robert. For your daughter, and for mine.
attributes.name: Impassioned Voice

attributes.content: Yes, Your Majesty... and for Victoria.
attributes.name: Sullen Voice

attributes.content: Hold on, Miss, don't run so fast—
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: I have to, Ailshie! I need to see my father!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I know he's at home today! If I'm not quick enough, he'll be off God-knows-where again!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: The Duke's been up to his ears in business recently, but if he knows you want to meet him, I'm sure he'd be willing to spend the time with you.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: I don't want him to spend time with me!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Then what are you in such a hurry to see him for?
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: I... I need to tell him, loud and clear, how I don't want to go to County York.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Don't you like the country? The manor out there's a lot more land than it is here. You used to love playing in the meadow, and you always had the farmers' kids there play cricket with you.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: I love it there!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: But it's hardly even summer yet—this time of year, we usually stay in Londinium. Plus, isn't it strange to you how it's just me and Mum going this time?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Calm down for now. I hear from the Manchesters' butler how a lot of the noble houses' Masters and Mistresses are summering in the country early this year. It might just be one of those new trends in society, you know?
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Don't give me that.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Ailshie, Dad's hiding from me. He wants me out of here. Why? Because I keep asking him to teach me swordsmanship, or because I can never get any Gaulish into my head? Is that why he has a temper at me?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Miss Allerdale, maybe it's not my place to say this, but...
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Well, my manners tutor isn't here right now, and I don't give two tosses what you should be saying or not.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: ...I can only offer my own opinion.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Miss, His Grace loves you very much. No matter what his decision is, it's going to be for the good of you and the Madam.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: If he wants good for me, that's more reason he shouldn't be sending me off.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I... I'll miss him. I'll miss him a lot, you know.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Ha, ha... Oh, come on, you. What's the blushing for?
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Because that's the kind of thing only little kids say!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I don't want Dad to think I'm attached to him! I need to be stronger, and then I can become a Steam Knight sooner, just like my great-great-great-great-grandmother—
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: But, you know, you are a child still.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: You should try telling him everything you've been feeling. He's a gentle, generous Duke, and a kind and caring father. I'm sure he'll understand you.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: So you'll let me see him?
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I always support you in your decisions.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: But you'd best be a little slower, so's you don't trip on the plants, or else Mr. Jim the gardener'll skip dinner again out of shame for getting you hurt.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Tell Jim it's his fault if his plants hurt me!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: *sigh* Really, what do we do with you?
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: And make sure you mind your skirt, Miss Allerdale... You've got an audience with His Majesty at the dinner tonight!
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Have you seen Charles Lynch anywhere?
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: The newly appointed Steam Knight, was it...? Incredible achievement at his age. I'm sure plenty came here just to mob him.
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: Shame he rushed off not long after he arrived. I hear every Steam Knight garrisoned in Londinium got orders to move.
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: ...Is it Sargon or Leithanien this time?
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: God save Victoria, no more wars. Every time one happens, I have to sell off a few more of my grandfather's paintings, rest his soul.
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: It's an order direct from Parliament this time.
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: ...Parliament?
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: Oh, of course... the Steam Knights sit under Parliament, don't they? You always get word so quick.
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: The more you're informed, the better you invest, especially in these times. This goes far further than how much pound sterling we make or lose.
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: We're deciding the nation's future, and that's precisely why we need to be in touch with more of the wisest.
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: Major Lynch is...
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: I think the proper title is Sir Charles now.
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: Sir Charles is a diligent and upstanding knight, loyal to our nation, to Victoria.
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: He's been aboard his high-speed warship defending us at the northern border for close to ten years, now. Countless meritorious deeds. Selected to be a Steam Knight, even at his young age. There's no telling how far he'll go.
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: I hear he used to live in Londinium, I think right here in Auchterigg? Come to think, I've never heard anything about his family.
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: No matter his family, he's a pillar of Victoria.
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: Those with the honor of joining the Steam Knights are much different stuff than in times past. You know the type, the court suck-up playing sycophant to the monarch.
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: Do I hear you ribbing at someone?
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: No, no, no, I would hardly. All I'm saying is, you see how His Majesty is surrounded by such fine company like Sir Charles, while there are people out there who've done nothing but rest their own laurels on their ancestry's honors. They're a pale shadow in—
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: Oh, dear... whose child is this? What are you barging about a dining hall for? You'll be dragged off forthwith if you bother His Majesty or His Grace!
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: The dress... the hair color... Richard, she's...
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: The Cumberlands are NOT suck-ups!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: We deserve steam armor! We'll charge enemy lines and give our lives for His Majesty and Victoria!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Miss Allerdale!
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Sir Lord, Lady Martha, dreadfully sorry... the Miss is just feeling unwell right now, she doesn't mean to be rude to the guests. I should have put her to bed, the blame is mine.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: What do you mean the blame is yours, Ailshie?!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: No one is allowed to sully the Cumberlands' honor!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I'll become a brilliant steam knight, like my ancestors were!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Just wait until I grow up... I—I'll prove it to all of you!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Miss!
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Excuse me.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: *sigh* Don't run so fast!
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Sir, Madam, I need to fetch Mistress Allerdale. If you'll pardon me.
attributes.name: Maid Ailshie

attributes.content: Well, then. Our Miss Allerdale seems to be a fine, outspoken young girl.
attributes.name: Noble Lady

attributes.content: Ah-heh... I thought we wouldn't have the chance to meet Miss Allerdale until the function tonight. How lucky of us, wouldn't you say, Martha?
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: Children can always afford to be innocent and naive. But whoever you may be...
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: You won't get away without growing up.
attributes.name: Noble Gentleman

attributes.content: Allerdale pants and gasps as she runs down a long, long passage.
She meant to seek her father, and she has no idea why she squeezes her way into this tiny room instead. It's far from both the ballroom and the Duke's study, practically neighboring the attic.
It's probably her fit of temper in this moment. She doesn't understand why her dad wants her gone, let alone why those posh-dressed visitors would say such things about the Cumberlands.
Every time life doesn't go her way, like when she loses a cricket match, or when her father the Duke misses her birthday party, this is where she comes, so she can have a chat with her old friend.
They've all forgotten! You were the mightiest knight the Steam Knights ever had!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: But my father taught me that true heroes aren't afraid to give their lives, and they're even less afraid of being forgotten... so I shouldn't have argued with them.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I really want to grow up soon... and then I'll become one of the glorious Steam Knights too, and rout all our enemies!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I'll make every single person who ever talked down on the Cumberlands too ashamed to lift their heads!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: I probably can't be as mighty as you were. But it'll be enough if I can just be half as... no... two-thirds as mighty.
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: Oh, but my father's said that as a Cumberland, I must hold the loftiest goals in mind! So...
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: You'll watch over me, can't you? I won't disappoint you, of course not!
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: (...Is someone here?!)
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: (Is it Ailshie?)
attributes.name: Allerdale

attributes.content: She doesn't want to be dragged back to the hall so soon, so she stoops down, and with a single step leaps behind the steam armor she knows so well.
The dilapidated suit shields her as if it was protecting the young desendant. Her dainty frame is completely concealed.
Strangers' footsteps encroach.
Most of her view is blocked by the suit; Allerdale can't make out their faces. The most she can glimpse is their distorted reflections.
Time's short, and chances are few. We need to confirm a few things.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Are you sure this place is safe?
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: It's as secluded as any nook or cranny gets. The rest of the visitors are all in the ballroom, still. No one's noticed us leave.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: No, someone has.
Not everyone loves to hang around in opulent halls with nothing to do, Allerdale thinks to herself.
I don't understand. Why not choose today? The lion's finally left his den for once, and hardly any of the Guard are here.
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: An assassination can't solve anything, and it won't.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Don't tell me you're scared of the gallows, Mister Dutyman.
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: Compared to your fear of poverty, I'd say getting hanged's a lighter affair for me.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: I'm SICK of spending my days with my brain and my wallet in others' hands. Chop-chop, please.
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: Even if the elder dies, there's still the cubs. The crown will remain seated firm on their heads, muzzling us like draft animals.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: If we can kill one king, we can kill a second.
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: Easier said. Listen, we have to be patient.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: The Steam Knights have all been sent out. By the time they return to Londinium, the dust will have settled.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: What will they do then?
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: The same as those paragon few. They'll do nothing for their own gain, and everything for Victoria. Even if it won't be handy to support our actions, they'll understand the decisions from on high.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Then that leaves the Royal Guard.
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: At the parade...
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: ...contain every Knight of the Tower... the key is seizing the city Defense Forces...
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: ...some dukes got fed up with it long ago...
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Allerdale's face presses against cold plate, but sweat nevertheless drips down her forehead.
It grows harder and harder not to move a muscle, not to mention keeping her breathing stifled. The voices of the two figures grow gradually out of reach, then suddenly are right before her.
For a blink, she quivers, trying as hard as she can not to let her body slip into view, curling even her toes in.
Has this lousy thing always been here?
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: First-generation steam knight armor.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: First-generation! That's over two hundred years ago. It's antique by now, isn't it? I'm sure it'd fetch a pretty price.
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: Haven't you seen the family crest? It's House Cumberland's steam armor.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Its old owner once stood before the Gaulish artillery in this, braced for three whole hours, just so His Majesty could flee unscathed together with his shattered people.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Only during battlefield cleanup did people realize half this suit had been blown away, and the one inside may well have died soon after bombardment began—
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: —but even dead, knights still persevere in protecting their own king and kin, reluctant to fall so soon.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: And here you're the one of Gaulish blood—I'm surprised you like reminiscing on these nobles' heroic deeds more than I do.
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: Fundamentally... I just bear respect for those we can call heroes.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Their belongings and your measuring of things don't mix. Even if this duke's home is razed to ash one day, the Cumberlands would never sell off this armor.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Hah... damned noble sense of honor, am I right? Utterly meaningless, in my view.
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: He's welcome to watch from his ivory tower all he likes, along with the rest of the dukes. No matter who the city's ruler nominally is, it won't make the dukes' authority any worse for wear, at least for the moment.
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: If he took the prudent path, then he wouldn't be Cumberland.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Why can't he just let go of his loyalty to the lions? With colossal change about to greet Victoria, you wish he'd recognize where his loyalty should lie, sooner rather than later.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: What's going on down there?
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: More men than you can count have surrounded the Duke's manor.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: Quiet. Listen carefully.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Intruders... Palace underground...
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Blade... thieved...
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Seal off all major streets in Auchterigg... no one in or out...
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Can you hear what they're saying down there?
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: They're searching for someone.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: Who?
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: His Majesty's entire Guard has moved out.
attributes.name: Indistinct Officer

attributes.content: They couldn't know we're meeting here... could they? What do we do, sir?
attributes.name: Obscured Merchant

attributes.content: A faint noise comes from in front of them, a sound like someone gently drawing breath.
Allerdale's heart pounds.
